question: The premises (p ∧ q) ∨ r and r → s imply which of the conclusion?
___________ means the ability to understand a language and use written and spoken language. People like poets, writers, have this category of intelligence?
An interpretation of a set of propositions is the assignment of a truth value, either T or F, to each propositional symbol?
The Application(s) of AI is/are?
In propositional calculus a sentence is _________ if it holds under every interpretation?
Clustering is an example of ___________?
What rules of inference are used in this argument? 'It is either colder than Himalaya today or the pollution is harmful. It is hotter than Himalaya today. Therefore, the pollution is harmful.'
An AI agent perceives and acts upon the environment using ___________?
A technique that was developed to determine whether a machine could or couldn't demonstrate the AI known as the_______________?
Watson is IBM's AI computer system capable of answering questions in natural language?
One of AI purposes is to use the power of computers to augment human thinking?
Systems that act and think rationally represent _______?

What rule of inference is used in this argument? 'If I go for a balanced diet, then I will be fit. If I will be fit, then I will remain healthy. Therefore, if I go for a balanced diet, then I will remain healthy.'
Rational agent is the agent that does the right thing (successful agent)?
Which rule of inference is used in each of these arguments, 'If it rains today, the local office will be closed. The local office is not closed today. Thus, it did not rain today.'
Machine Learning is the superset that contains AI?
The predicate logic for the statement 'Every cat is an animal' is: There exists X (cat(X) → animal(X))?

What rules of inference are used in this argument? 'All students in this science class have taken a course in physics' and 'Marry is a student in this class' imply the conclusion 'Marry has taken a course in physics.'
In_____________ there is no way to access the components of an individual sentence?
What rules of inference are used in this argument? 'Jay is an awesome student. Jay is also a good dancer. Therefore, Jay is an awesome student and a good dancer.'
The godfather of AI is __________?
An argument is a sequence of statements that end with a conclusion?
Machine learning is similar to data mining as it also deals with the small amount of the data?
“John is out for a trip or it is not snowing” and “It is snowing or Smith is playing chess” imply that __________?
choices: A. John is out for trip
C. John is out for a trip and Smith is playing chess
D. John is out for a trip or Smith is playing chess

question: Modern Machine learning models can be used for making various predictions, including Weather prediction, Stock market analysis, Disease prediction, etc?
The predicate logic for the statement 'Any animal that has a feather is a bird' is: For all (X) (animal(X) ˄ has(X, feather) → bird(X))?
AI is about_________________?
choices: A. Programming on machine with your own intelligence
C. Playing a game on computer
D. Putting your intelligence in machine

question: Which rule of inference is used in each of these arguments, “If it is Thursday then the downtown will be crowded. It is Thursday. Thus, the downtown is crowded.”?
______________ requires no training, no massive amount of data and no guess work?
__________ is a theory of learning which states that all behaviors are learned through interaction with the environment?
